member.name: M:NStandard.XString.NormalizeNewLine(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a new string which is normalized by the newline string of current environment.
If a string come from non-Unix platforms, then its NewLine is "\r\n".
If a string come from Unix platforms, then its NewLine is "\n".

member.name: M:NStandard.XString.GetPureLines(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Divides a string into multi-lines (ignore Empty or WhiteSpace). If the string is null, return string[0]. (Perhaps you should set `normalizeNewLine` to true to convert the NewLine which is defined in other system into the current system's.)

member.name: M:NStandard.XString.GetLines(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Divides a string into multi-lines. If the string is null, return string[0]. (Perhaps you should set `normalizeNewLine` to true to convert the NewLine which is defined in other system into the current system's.)
